project.teaser: SINFONICA aims to develop functional, efficient, and innovative strategies, methods and tools to engage CCAM users, providers and other stakeholders (i.e. citizens, including vulnerable users, transport operators, public administrations, service providers, researchers, vehicle...
project.objective: SINFONICA aims to develop functional, efficient, and innovative strategies, methods and tools to engage CCAM users, providers and other stakeholders (i.e. citizens, including vulnerable users, transport operators, public administrations, service providers, researchers, vehicle and technology suppliers) to collect, understand and structure in a manageable and exploitable way their needs, desires, and concerns related to CCAM. SINFONICA will co-create final decision support tools for designers and decision makers to enhance the CCAM seamless and sustainable deployment, to be inclusive and equitable for all citizens.
project.title: Social INnovation to FOster iNclusIve Cooperative, connected and Automated mobility
project.keywords: society, users, co-creation, accessibility, public transport, rural mobility, urban mobility, acceptability, expectations, needs, recommendations, knowledge, inclusiveness, user-centred, accessibility

article.title: Building European capacity for Connected, Cooperative and Automated Mobility
Ensuring AVs can safely navigate everything in their path
A model library of driving behaviours
All-weather sensors see driverless freight vehicles roll out at airports, ports and logistic hubs
Showcasing the benefits of automated vehicles for sustainable urban transport
Assessing societal impacts of new CCAM interventions
Developing robust self-driving vehicles that can go the distance
Decision-making tools for smarter, safer mobility
Trustworthy data is key to rolling out automated vehicles
Smart modelling leaves European gridlock in the rear-view mirror
Automated mobility starts with physical and digital infrastructure
Protecting Europe’s connected cars against cyberthreats
Putting citizens at the heart of the transport revolution
Establishing a European framework for connected, cooperative and automated driving

category.title: Results Pack
category.description: Article: Collections of results, from finished or nearly completed projects, focusing on a specific theme that you can apply in your domain

article.teaser: New mobility solutions enabled by connected, cooperative and automated mobility (CCAM) will increase the safety, traffic efficiency and accessibility of Europe’s road transport system. This CORDIS Results Pack highlights 15 EU-funded projects addressing the technological, regulatory and social challenges of automated transport systems, paving the way for more sustainable and equitable transport in the future.

article.title: Putting citizens at the heart of the transport revolution
Building European capacity for Connected, Cooperative and Automated Mobility

category.title: Results Pack
category.description: Article: Collections of results, from finished or nearly completed projects, focusing on a specific theme that you can apply in your domain

article.teaser: Understanding the needs of citizens will help Europe to develop inclusive transport systems for the future. The EU-funded SINFONICA project is helping to ensure nobody is left behind.

result.title: SINFONICA Knowledge Map Explorer validation
result.description: It will specify the steps of the tool’s validation process, participants and testing scenarios and will report the outcomes of the validation testing.

result.title: Preliminary exploitation plan
result.description: Initial exploitation plan of the project, collecting views from each partner about the individual exploitation strategy.

result.title: Final report on dissemination and communication activities
result.description: Final report on all Communication & Dissemination activities performed by the project – and all partners individually – during the last year of the project. This report will include an overview of all the Communication & Dissemination activities performed by the SINFONICA project.

result.title: Innovation Management
result.description: Handbook in the tailored-made GUEST methodology, describing the operational steps, the tools as well as how to guide and measure the overall process. Support material for the dissemination of the tailored-made GUEST (slides, user manual, templates of all the tools).

result.title: Report for activities in the groups of interest
result.description: In this deliverable, each group of interest will report the activities performed in the T3.1, T3.2, T3.3, T3.4.

result.title: Guidance and recommendations for demonstrating and implementing user-centric CCAM
result.description: Report providing strategies for developing, testing, deploying, operating, and evaluating CCAM, including communication strategies with future users and citizens with respect to CCAM. This report will also incorporate the final recommendations for large-scale demonstration projects (updated recommendations from D5.3) updated and refined as a result of liaison with ongoing demonstration projects and outcomes from the data analysis from the cities, simulations, upscaling from T3.7 and the Knowledge Map Explorer.

result.title: Understanding and Addressing Diverse Mobility Needs: A Framework for CCAM Solutions

details.journalTitle: HFES Europe Annual Chapter. Lübeck, Germany, April 17-19, 2024

result.title: Report on dissemination and communication activities and update of the dissemination and communication plan
result.description: Report on all Communication & Dissemination activities performed by the project – and all partners individually – in the first 18 months of the project.

result.title: CCAM vocabulary and stakeholders needs and requirements for CCAM solutions
result.description: This deliverable will be output of T1.2 and develops a clear definition of existing and future CCAM technologies and services, and reviews the needs and requirements of relevant and important stakeholders (e.g. policy makers, authorities, hospitals, schools etc.) towards the deployment of CCAM solutions.

result.title: Vision policy recommendations for user-centric CCAM
result.description: Report aimed principally at policymakers providing a vision for socially inclusive and equitable CCAM and policy recommendations at the strategic level.

result.title: GUEST Methodology & SINFONICA: How to Effectively Deploy Socio-centric Social Innovation

details.authors: Bruni M.E., Merlo F., Perboli G., Renzi G.

result.title: Understanding the Gap of CCAM solutions deployment
result.description: This deliverable will be output of T1.3 and assess the current CCAM solutions and deployments by comparing them with the mobility needs and the requirements and vision of stakeholders of T1.1 and T1.2 in order to understand and highlight the gaps that SINFONICA project is trying to bridge.

result.title: CCAM local simulations
result.description: Exploration of CCAM local value cases for the groups of interest, populated with a range of socio-economic KPI to support strategic decision-making.

result.title: Generic Simulation Framework for CCAM solutions
result.description: This report will present the added capabilities to the AMoDeus fleet dispatching framework by providing analyses of standard test cases in literature

result.title: Mobility needs and requirements of European citizens
result.description: This deliverable will be the output of T1.1 and review the existing literature and projects about mobility needs of European citizens and specific vulnerable groups.

result.title: Equity practices and social indicators
result.description: Report on best practices in social equity with respect to smart mobility, focusing on CCAM solutions and issues.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SINFONICA (Social INnovation to FOster iNclusIve Cooperative, connected and Automated mobility)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: The SINFONICA project has the ambition to facilitate the shift towards innovative, smart CCAM concepts, through the definition of a user-centric participatory approach, oriented towards gathering the needs, concerns, desires and expectations of CCAM users, suppliers and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Understanding Mobility Needs and Designing Inclusive CCAM Solutions: A Literature Review and Framework

details.authors: Madlen Ringhand, Juliane Anke, David Schackmann
details.journalTitle: Communications in Computer and Information Science, HCI International 2024 Posters

result.title: SINFONICA Knowledge map creation and System Architecture specification
result.description: The deliverable will be the output of Tasks 4.1 and 4.2 in order to deliver the Ontological Schema of the SINFONICA knowledge base and will document the overall system architecture.

result.title: Communication & dissemination plan
result.description: Report on guidelines for communication & dissemination, presenting the objectives, target audience, messages, tools and channels (including events and social media), partners’ roles and monitoring procedures (KPIs).

result.title: Participatory methods to capture mobility needs and future expectations from CCAM process
result.description: The report will present the practical guidelines to implement the participatory methods in the four groups of interest (focus groups, interviews, and workshops).

result.title: Evaluation of engagement and data collection activities
result.description: The results of the activities of the T3.5, together with the final evaluation of the strategies and methodologies implemented by the four groups of interest will constitute the D3.2.

result.title: CCAM solutions and vulnerable users: Opportunities and constraints
result.description: Report on opportunities and constraints of CCAM regarding users with specific needs, including trade-offs (e.g. accessibility versus cost).

result.title: Engagement guidance for CCAM solutions
result.description: The report will present the guidelines to support the groups of interest in their local engagement activities.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
